title: Interstellar
description: In a future where Earth is slowly dying, humanitys survival depends on venturing into the stars. A former pilot is recruited for a daring mission: to travel through a newly discovered wormhole and search for a new home among the stars.As the crew faces unimaginable challenges across space and time, their journey becomes not only a fight for survival, but also a profound exploration of love, sacrifice, and the very limits of human possibility.

comments.description: Without a doubt, one of the best films of this century. Great work by the director, who makes this a work of art and captivates you from beginning to end.
5/5. An incredible film, with one of the best soundtracks in cinematic history. Christopher Nolan made a great success by bringing back Hans Zimmer. A masterpiece.

A bit overrated. I like the space, but it's not well adapted. There are other films that, in my opinion, have better adaptations and are more believable. I also want to congratulate the director and the production team because it's visually unbeatable. Great work!

title: How to train your dragon
description: Hiccup, a teenage Viking, begins dragon training classes, and finally sees an opportunity to prove he is capable of becoming a warrior, when he befriends an injured dragon.

comments.description: An amazing continuation of the story. The animation is gorgeous, and the emotional depth is perfect. I was on the edge of my seat the entire time. The relationship between Hiccup and Toothless is heartwarming, and the plot twists had me in tears. Truly a masterpiece.

It was a good movie, but not as impressive as the first one. The pacing was a bit slow in parts, and I didn’t connect as much with the characters this time around. It’s still fun to watch, but it lacks that initial charm.

While the visuals are stunning and the action sequences are top-notch, I felt the story was a bit predictable. The emotional moments were impactful, but overall, it didn't hold the same magic as the first film. Still, a solid sequel.

title: The secret live of Walter Mity
description: Walter Mitty, photo editor at Life magazine,has spent his whole life taking little "mental vacations" to escape his boring existence, moments in which he becomes the imaginary protagonist of fantastic adventures.

comments.description: A beautiful film that combines fantasy with reality in a way that makes you reflect on your own life. Ben Stiller did an excellent job as both director and actor. The landscapes were breathtaking, and the soundtrack fit perfectly. A must-see for dreamers!

While the film had some beautiful shots and touching moments, I felt it was a bit too idealistic and far-fetched. Walter's journey is inspiring, but at times it felt like a fantasy that didn’t connect with the struggles of real life. Still worth watching for the visuals.

An inspiring and quirky film that captures the beauty of life outside the ordinary. The character development was fantastic, and the movie has an emotional core. It's a bit slow at times, but the message it sends about living life fully is powerful.

title: Dunkerke
description: Germany advances into France, trapping Allied troops on the beaches of Dunkirk.Under air and ground protection from British and French forces, the troops are slowly evacuated from the beach using any available vessels.

comments.description: A gripping and intense war film that immerses you in the chaos and heroism of the Dunkirk evacuation. Christopher Nolan does an incredible job at making you feel like you're in the middle of the action. The lack of a typical narrative is refreshing, and the tension is palpable throughout.

Dunkirk is a visually stunning film, but I felt it lacked the emotional depth of other war movies. The non-linear storytelling and minimal dialogue didn’t work for me. Still, it's worth watching for the incredible cinematography and sound design.

While technically brilliant, Dunkirk didn't resonate with me on an emotional level. The lack of character development left me feeling disconnected, and I found the film a bit too cold. It's definitely an experience, but not one I'd watch again.

title: Megamind
description: Megamind is a supervillain.For years, he has tried to conquer Metro City, but a hero named Metro Man stood in his way.After many attempts, Megamind finally manages to kill him.Suddenly, his life has no meaning.What can a supervillain do without a superhero to fight? Create Titan, a new hero.

comments.description: A hilarious and unique take on the superhero genre. Will Ferrell's voice acting as Megamind is spot on, and the film has a great message about redemption and identity. It's an entertaining watch for both kids and adults!

Megamind is fun, but it didn’t really offer anything new to the superhero genre. The story is predictable, and while it’s entertaining, it felt like a missed opportunity to explore deeper themes. Still, it’s enjoyable for a light-hearted movie night.

A surprisingly fun and clever animated film. The characters are well-developed, and the plot is full of twists that keep you entertained. Megamind is a fresh take on a classic superhero tale, with a great voice cast and animation.

title: Tenet
description: An epic action story revolving around international espionage, time travel, and evolution, in which a secret agent must prevent World War III.

comments.description: Christopher Nolan does it again! Tenet is a mind-bending rollercoaster of a film that will have you questioning time, reality, and everything in between. The action sequences are phenomenal, and the plot is intricate. It’s a puzzle that leaves you thinking long after the credits roll.

I was excited to see Tenet, but honestly, I found it confusing at times. The plot twists were hard to follow, and I had to rewind multiple scenes. It’s a visually impressive film, but it wasn’t as enjoyable as Nolan’s other works. Still, I admire the ambition.

A thrilling, high-concept action film. Tenet keeps you on the edge of your seat, but the story can be tough to follow, especially with the time inversion concept. It's a visually stunning film, and I respect the creativity, but it's a bit too complex for casual viewers. Great work!

title: Spiderman-Far-From-Home
description: Peter Parker decides to take a well-deserved vacation in Europe with MJ, Ned, and the rest of his friends. However, Peter must don the Spider-Man suit once again when Nick Fury entrusts him with a new mission: to stop an attack by creatures that are causing chaos across the continent.

comments.description: One of the best Spider-Man films yet! Tom Holland delivers another fantastic performance, and the plot is both fun and emotional. The visuals are amazing, and the twist with Mysterio was mind-blowing. A great continuation of the MCU!

Far From Home is a solid Spider-Man movie, but it doesn't quite capture the same magic as Homecoming. Mysterio was a great villain, but I felt the pacing was off in some parts. Still, a fun and entertaining movie that keeps you hooked.

A decent Spider-Man movie, but not as exciting as I hoped. The storyline was predictable, and some of the CGI was over the top. It's enjoyable, but I think the film could’ve done more with the characters and the villain.

title: Saving private Ryan
description: Following the Normandy landings, in the midst of World War II, American soldiers must risk their lives to save Private James Ryan, whose three brothers have died in the war.

comments.description: An absolute masterpiece. Spielberg captures the brutal reality of war with raw emotion and impeccable filmmaking. Tom Hanks and the cast deliver incredible performances, and the battle scenes are some of the most intense I’ve ever seen. A must-watch for any film lover.

Saving Private Ryan is a powerful film, but at times the violence felt excessive. While the performances are top-notch, the movie can be difficult to watch due to its gritty and intense portrayal of war. Still, it’s a highly respected film.

A great war film with some incredibly realistic and emotional moments, but I felt it was a bit long and repetitive in parts. The action is gripping, but the pacing could’ve been better. It’s still a very important film, though.

title: Súper López
description: The planet Chitón is about to fall into the hands of an evil leader.Its inhabitants only hope is the baby Jo-Con-Él, who is sent to Earth in a rocket that does not quite land where his parents intended.

comments.description: I really wanted to like Super López, but it just didn’t hit the mark for me. The humor felt forced, and the story was a bit predictable. It’s a light comedy, but it’s not as clever as other superhero parodies.

Super López is a fun, light-hearted Spanish superhero film. It’s a great watch for fans of quirky comedies. The humor is silly but endearing, and I loved the take on the superhero genre. It’s not groundbreaking, but it’s a fun ride.

A charming and goofy Spanish film. Super López is a fun take on the superhero genre, and while it's not perfect, it’s a good choice for a family movie night. The actors were great, and there were some genuinely funny moments.

title: Only the Brave
description: Film based on Sean Flynn,s GQ article about the first municipal fire department to become an elite squad, the Granite Mountain Hotshots, who had to face the massive wildfire that broke out in Yarnell Hill, Arizona, in June 2013.

comments.description: An inspiring story about real-life heroes, but the film felt like it dragged at times. The performances are great, and the emotional weight of the story comes through, but I would’ve liked to see more of the action.

Only the Brave is an emotional tribute to the firefighters who risked their lives. While the movie is heartfelt and well-acted, I felt it was a bit slow in some areas. It’s definitely a touching story, but not as impactful as I expected.

A truly moving and heroic film that honors the bravery of the Granite Mountain Hotshots. The performances are powerful, and the storytelling is heart-wrenching. It’s a must-see for anyone who appreciates real-life heroes.

title: The secret soldiers of benghazi
description: On September 11, 2012, the United States embassy in the Libyan city of Benghazi was the target of a terrorist attack. Six former elite soldiers, whose mission was to protect the CIA, fought fiercely to defend the embassy staff.

comments.description: The film is full of action and suspense, but I felt it could’ve done more to explore the characters and the real-life events. It’s entertaining, but it lacks the depth that would’ve made it more impactful. Still, a solid war thriller.

A gripping and intense film that brings the terrifying events of Benghazi to life. The action is non-stop, and the performances are top-tier. Michael Bay does a fantastic job at balancing emotion with action. A must-watch for thriller fans.

A solid action film, but it felt more like a war thriller than a deep political drama. While the combat scenes are intense, the characters felt a bit underdeveloped. Still, it’s a powerful film with important historical context.

description: The film follows two young British soldiers over the course of a single day in the darkest days of World War I.

comments.description: One of the best war films I’ve seen. The continuous shot technique is amazing and adds so much tension to the story. The performances are outstanding, and the film perfectly captures the chaos and desperation of war. Truly unforgettable.

1917 is an impressive technical achievement, but the story itself felt a bit thin. The action and cinematography are breathtaking, but I was expecting more emotional depth. It’s a visually stunning film, though, and worth watching for the experience.

A visually stunning film with great action sequences, but I didn’t feel as connected to the characters as I’d hoped. The one-shot technique is impressive, but I found the film to be a bit repetitive in places. Still, it’s worth a watch.

title: Napoleon
description: The military and political career of Napoleon Bonaparte, from his beginnings in the revolutionary era to the defeat of the empire with which he conquered Europe. The figure of the Corsican strategist is portrayed through his relationship with Josephine.

comments.description: One of the best war films I’ve seen. The continuous shot technique is amazing and adds so much tension to the story. The performances are outstanding, and the film perfectly captures the chaos and desperation of war. Truly unforgettable.

1917 is an impressive technical achievement, but the story itself felt a bit thin. The action and cinematography are breathtaking, but I was expecting more emotional depth. It’s a visually stunning film, though, and worth watching for the experience.

A visually stunning film with great action sequences, but I didn’t feel as connected to the characters as I’d hoped. The one-shot technique is impressive, but I found the film to be a bit repetitive in places. Still, it’s worth a watch.

title: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl
description: Pirates of the Caribbean: The Curse of the Black Pearl (2003) follows Captain Jack Sparrow, a charismatic and cunning pirate, as he seeks to recover his stolen ship, the Black Pearl. Along the way, he teams up with Will Turner, a skilled blacksmith, and Elizabeth Swann, a noblewoman with a mysterious connection to the ship. The trio must stop the cursed crew of the Black Pearl, led by Captain Hector Barbossa, who are doomed to live as undead pirates until they retrieve a stolen cursed treasure. The film blends adventure, action, and supernatural elements in a quest for treasure, redemption, and freedom.

comments.description: One of the best war films I’ve seen. The continuous shot technique is amazing and adds so much tension to the story. The performances are outstanding, and the film perfectly captures the chaos and desperation of war. Truly unforgettable.

1917 is an impressive technical achievement, but the story itself felt a bit thin. The action and cinematography are breathtaking, but I was expecting more emotional depth. It’s a visually stunning film, though, and worth watching for the experience.

A visually stunning film with great action sequences, but I didn’t feel as connected to the characters as I’d hoped. The one-shot technique is impressive, but I found the film to be a bit repetitive in places. Still, it’s worth a watch.

title: The Batman
description: The Batman (2022) is a dark and gritty reimagining of the iconic superhero. Set in his second year of fighting crime, Batman (Robert Pattinson) uncovers a web of corruption and crime in Gotham City as he faces off against the mysterious serial killer known as The Riddler (Paul Dano). Along the way, Batman forms uneasy alliances with Selina Kyle (Zoe Kravitz), aka Catwoman, and detective James Gordon, while grappling with his own troubled past. The film dives into themes of justice, vengeance, and the blurry line between them.

comments.description: One of the best war films I’ve seen. The continuous shot technique is amazing and adds so much tension to the story. The performances are outstanding, and the film perfectly captures the chaos and desperation of war. Truly unforgettable.

1917 is an impressive technical achievement, but the story itself felt a bit thin. The action and cinematography are breathtaking, but I was expecting more emotional depth. It’s a visually stunning film, though, and worth watching for the experience.

A visually stunning film with great action sequences, but I didn’t feel as connected to the characters as I’d hoped. The one-shot technique is impressive, but I found the film to be a bit repetitive in places. Still, it’s worth a watch.

title: It
description: It (2017) is a horror film based on Stephen King's novel. Set in the 1980s, a group of outcast kids in the town of Derry, Maine, are terrorized by a shape-shifting entity that often takes the form of a creepy clown named Pennywise. As they uncover the entity's dark history, the group must face their deepest fears to stop it from claiming more victims. The film explores themes of friendship, courage, and the power of overcoming fear.

comments.description: One of the best war films I’ve seen. The continuous shot technique is amazing and adds so much tension to the story. The performances are outstanding, and the film perfectly captures the chaos and desperation of war. Truly unforgettable.

1917 is an impressive technical achievement, but the story itself felt a bit thin. The action and cinematography are breathtaking, but I was expecting more emotional depth. It’s a visually stunning film, though, and worth watching for the experience.

A visually stunning film with great action sequences, but I didn’t feel as connected to the characters as I’d hoped. The one-shot technique is impressive, but I found the film to be a bit repetitive in places. Still, it’s worth a watch.

title: The Hobbit: An Unexpected Journey
description: The film follows Bilbo Baggins, a home-loving Hobbit from the Shire, who is unexpectedly swept into an epic quest. He is recruited by the wizard Gandalf the Grey and a company of thirteen Dwarves, led by the legendary warrior Thorin Oakenshield. Their goal is to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug.

comments.description: A great movie, I loved it. Highly recommended and I give it five stars. I love Martin Freeman's performance; he's a great actor. The movie is very funny and very well adapted. Congratulations!

It's a fantastic film! The locations, the actors, the lead actor—everything is perfect. If you enjoyed the Lord of the Rings films, I think this one surpasses them. It has less fighting and more substance than the previous installments. The actor who plays Bilbo has an impressive range of expression and gestures, and the special effects are amazing. Coppola is to The Godfather what Peter Jackson is to fantasy films—he's created a masterpiece!

A bore. Slow, long, tedious, boring. They're taking us for fools. Almost three hours, and I think the whole thing could be told in one. PURE COMMERCIAL CAPITALISM. I'll download parts 2 and 3 from the internet, Mr. Director.

title: The Nun
description: The film follows Bilbo Baggins, a home-loving Hobbit from the Shire, who is unexpectedly swept into an epic quest. He is recruited by the wizard Gandalf the Grey and a company of thirteen Dwarves, led by the legendary warrior Thorin Oakenshield. Their goal is to reclaim the lost Dwarf Kingdom of Erebor from the fearsome dragon Smaug.

comments.description: Fantastic movie, I was scared the whole time. Highly recommended for a good night in.

A very good film that ties in very well with The Conjuring universe. Great special effects and superb cinematography. I expected nothing less from this spin-off about the nun who appears in The Conjuring 2. It provides some answers at the end, which are revealed if you go and see the movie.

In my opinion, the movie is good for passing the time at the cinema. Although, it's an hour and a half long, but that hour and a half is one scare after another… But the good thing about the scares is that they keep you from falling asleep halfway through and keep you engaged in the story. In short, in my opinion, The Nun is a good movie.
